sub_title: Partner at ELP Network | Realising Breakthroughs
summary:
I enable leaders, teams and organisations in being relevant and purposeful. 

I work with two main types of organisations:

The first are those scaling up; they are growing their customer base so fast & onboarding so many newcomers so quickly they need support in creating focus and determining the pace of growth. I help them in building a coalition to setup and realise a critical path and creating the systems, behaviours, practices and mindset needed for execution-as-learning (knowing that as a scaleup, what got you here, won’t get you there).

The second are those potentially reaching a growth stall point. I help them 1. reframe their assumptions for which customers they create value and how they make money by delivering what they promise at an appropriate cost; and 2. develop innovative capabilities by overcoming biases to spot new growth opportunities and create new product/service offerings.

I work across industries and sectors (corporate, non-corporate, public). Leaders & teams I work with experience my ability to quickly learn and understand the nuances of their business without being an in-depth expert. I am uniquely masterful in translating abstract into pragmatic; helping teams go from insights and inspiration, to deciding & committing on shared vision & path forward and developing capabilities & practices to execute & realise their goals.

I am a partner at ELP Network where we architect new ways of value creation that organisations need to stay relevant in today’s complex world. 

Areas of expertise:
•	customer engagement 
•	innovation capability building
•	vision development & realisation
•	strategic design & realisation
•	stakeholder engagement & supplier partnerships
•	team & leadership development

treasury_media.title: Un-Machine Yourself Podcast Episode: daring to connect, daring to ask, and daring to grow!
treasury_media.description: Roanne van Voorst, Ph.D. had me on the Un-Machine Yourself podcast hosted by Hatch - Immersive learning experiences. We had a fun and wide-ranging chat about daring to speak up, challenge and ask questions, beginner’s mindset and joy for exploring future possibilities, creating space and setting boundaries to get to deep thinking., reframing futureproofing from minimising risks to maximising possibilities and the types of companies I hope to see scaling up.

education.field_of_study: Master Class Strategic Value of Design
Sales, Distribution, and Marketing Operations, General

profile_positions.description:
Growth asks for breakthroughs: in your view of the world and of your markets; in your positioning; and in your interaction with clients and stakeholders; in the way you think, behave and work together; in your aspirations, habits and beliefs; in your relationships with others.

ELP Network is an international network company focused on realising breakthroughs. Our purpose is to support organisations and their leaders in creating sustainable growth and in realising their next level of performance: enabling them to be better, future proof, robust… bigger perhaps, but certainly more enduring, inspired and committed.

For more information or a conversation, visit elpnetwork.com.
profile_positions.title: Partner

profile_positions.description:
Facilitating workshops and delivering personal coaching for management teams, senior managers and high-potential talent groups. Topics of expertise include customer loyalty, product & service innovation, the impact of social technologies, strategic leadership behaviour, decision-making, strategy development and customer & employee engagement. 

Facilitating client and ELP Network practitioner teams during co-delivery of multi-year interventions.

Facilitating in-client breakthrough teams in strategic roadmapping & review process.

Speaker and workshop facilitator on the topic of ‘connect & collaborate’ leadership styles at conferences including the International Leadership Association, the Women’s International Networking Conference, LEAPWomen and the Wall Street Journal Europe’s Future Leadership Summit.

Consistent positive client feedback on impact and relevance of approach (average evaluation 4.5 on 5 scale)
profile_positions.title: Facilitator & Coach

profile_positions.description:
Leading ELP's Breakthrough Studio, which supports the development of new directions for innovation and organisational renewal. The studio combines tools, techniques, know-how and experience from the world of management, business schools, science and the performing arts to co-create new options for sustainable growth in volatile & complex environments. 

Ensuring the quality of ELP’s work by growing the capabilities of ELP’s network of professionals and managing ELP’s Breakthrough Studio team

Guiding ELP's multi-disciplinary teams in design processes to create breakthrough solutions for clients

Facilitating & coaching management teams and breakthrough teams in key client accounts

Member of ELP’s management team
profile_positions.title: Creative Director

profile_positions.description:
Leading acquisition process towards current clients and new clients. Responsible for developing response to client tenders. Sales expectations overachieved. 

Negotiating and controlling significant program budgets with program size ranging from 10 to 500 participants.

Account management & program management for key accounts.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
Working closely with clients to co-design, stage and deliver interventions strategy & leadership interventions covering a range topics such as customer loyalty, branding, employee engagement, strategy development, leadership development and sustainability.

Overseeing content and material development such as client-specific cases, future scenarios, presentations, and diagnostic tools. 

Integrating the expertise of ELP’s network of experienced executives and organisation development practitioners from business, academia and the arts into client projects (content & tool development and delivery)

Controlling significant program budgets with program size ranging from 10 to 500 participants.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
WINext connects intelligence across borders to find and accelerate new ways of value creation.
- More connected with and responsive to customers and society,
- More adaptive, innovative and focused on execution-as-learning,
- Connecting business with purpose.

As Programme Director of the WINext Scale Up Executive Tracks, I support the executive teams to articulate and align on their scale up challenges and to connect the content and inspiration from the track to their challenges and for roadmapping their next steps.
profile_positions.title: Programme Director, Scale Up Executive Track

profile_positions.description:
Designed and executed global initiatives resulting in 40% increase in the pool of student and graduates available for internships and 16% increase in number of internships facilitated. These results were achieved during a time when the data on AIESEC’s global information system was migrated and a new system was launched.

Designed and implemented an online internship process connected to the development of AIESEC’s new global information management system.  

Strengthened AIESEC’s positioning to students and graduates with social sciences (35% increase in students attracted) and technical backgrounds (53% increase in students attracted).

Provided consultancy AIESEC teams in emerging markets BRIC (Brazil, Russia, India, China) supporting a 71% increase in students and businesses attracted in BRIC countries.

Monthly and quarterly performance analysis of internship program and publishing detailed trend reports.
profile_positions.title: Global Program Director, International Internships

profile_positions.description:
Provided strategic consultancy, in Spanish, to 18 national offices in the region.

Designed and lead the execution of a new regional business development initiative to increase AIESEC’s market presence in the region (26% increase in students and businesses attracted)

Initiated partnerships with leading Latin American businesses including PwC, Philips, Unilever, DHL, Petrobras, and McGraw-Hill.

Successfully delivered 2 regional funding partnerships (Artemisia & Ashoka, W.K. Kellogg Foundation), with 1 account expanding to a global partnership.

Selected, trained, and managed a regional team responsible for delivering regional accounts and initiatives.

Financial management of budget worth €100,000: supervised revenue generation and investment strategy.

Managed the development and execution of 3 regional meetings and 1 regional conference.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Director, Iberoamerica Region

profile_positions.description:
Lead an executive team of 8 responsible for managing AIESEC’s national operations (27 local offices).

Directly reported to a 10 person national Board of Directors, including senior executives of Bombardier, National Bank, Ernst and Young, and the co-operators. 

Managed the execution of the annual national plan and year 2 of a 3 year strategic plan, resulting in 32% growth in student membership and 12% increase in students and businesses attracted to internships

Financial management of budget worth €424,700: supervised revenue generation and investment strategy including the implementation of a new internship pricing model and establishment of an endowment fund.

External representation of AIESEC in key (inter)national forums, corporate, and non-corporate networks.
profile_positions.title: President

profile_positions.description:
Fundraised over €177,000 (17% growth) from Canadian businesses and government to support operations. 

Developed and initiated a long term national communications strategy to align to AIESEC’s global brand.
profile_positions.title: Vice-President, Corporate Development

profile_positions.description:
Conducted research on immigration help centers across Canada, foreign credential recognition, and workplace training assessments.

Overall editorial responsibility for skillnet.ca an online Canadian career site for foreigners and new Canadian immigrants. Developed a new publishing schedule and created content with a team of freelance writers.
